content:
Hello.
I got this in reverse mode, and it was pretty cool.
I had a discrepancy between tests and validators, though, from 100% to 83%, and I've figured out why:
The binary validator has 0 in the tenths (.01). In a hurry, and not trusting floats, I printed the number / 100, then ".", then the number %100. I see why that was a mistake, and I could have easily corrected it, but that one validator is the only place there's a 0 after the decimal point.
Maybe having one of the tests with a .0n would alert others who make this mistake before they submit.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great idea.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A very interesting task, beautiful design. I like! With the help of the wiki and the example, the task becomes clear!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really solid debut! It takes a minute to get one's bearings, but once you realize the abacus is just a representation of a positional number system (like decimal, binary, etc.), it's very approachable. Looking forward to solving this one. Great job!
Hi, this is my first contribution, feedback is appreciated!
